title: Mount Rushmore National Memorial: Birds
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Birds                Birds         A white-breasted nuthatch climbing down the bark of a ponderosa pine tree. NPS Photo  Many different birds live at Mount Rushmore during different parts of the year, including this white-breasted nuthatch (pictured at right). Nuthatches, which live here year round, eat insects, nuts and seeds. Watch for them creeping head first down ponderosa pine trunks in search of food. Visit the photo gallery below to see images of some of the commonly seen birds at Mount Rushmore.  Â                 Birds at Mount Rushmore   3 Photos  This gallery contains images of some of the birds you are likely to see at Mount Rushmore National Memorial.
